ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Very useful if interested in structural methods, less otherwise

This course is a good introduction to structural labor economics. However, prior training in labor is a good idea. The reading group helped quite a bit in improving understanding. It's important to read papers from the class and ask questions. The final is very fair.
Labor economics at the frontier. It will help to go through the basics by yourself first.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I learned various labor methods, and the main topics the field deals with. I still feel I don't the main "conclusions" of the research so far, and I still have a hard time understanding the more technical papers
Very helpful. Deepened and widened my knowledge a lot.
